tweets.text: And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/GbRf12Csn1

My last visit as #Ops Manager for ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyMids‚Å©, so pleased to be able to see 2 of the 6 new pumps at #Keadby pumping station, side by side with the 81yr old pumps. The old pumps are being decommissioned one by one, to ensure we are able to maintain pumping capacity. https://t.co/zankQoLqOW

We've  teams out across the region inspecting our assets  preparing for the forecast of heavy rain. 

These photos are from Todmorden, Calderdale where we're bolstering our flood defences as a precaution.

Sign up to our free flood warning service  https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#Floods https://t.co/kwonQEXVFv

@ICE_engineers @metoffice @NatInfraCom @Forum4theFuture @keelingcurve @EdinburghUni @SthlmMayor @NatureScotCEO @timchapman_ @ArupGroup @EnvAgency Have to say that I‚Äôm pretty excited to share the full film (including all these amazing people - and more) with you all next Tuesday. Sign up here if you haven‚Äôt already... https://t.co/Nls209chSG

@Calderdale @metoffice @EnvAgencyYNE Well I've been at home all day on Burnley Road, 0 Street cleaners seen. This road is a MAJOR, flood risk for surface water. But, hey ho, we're only todmorden on the edge of calderdale. Talk about black sheep.
Our teams right across the country are preparing and responding to the heavy rainfall. We'll have staff working 24/7 over the next few days. Follow @EnvAgency https://t.co/EO7xjiC084

We're expecting heavy rain across the North East and Yorkshire this weekend with increased risk of flooding. 

You can check the latest information on flood warnings and alerts here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

#flood 
#flooding 
#rain 
#weather https://t.co/5owx8pl9el

Trying to predict flood risk for friends by rivers based on forecast rainfall and experience from Storms Ciara and Dennis in February this year.
